pages.text: Use the chisel on a frame or illusion cube block to change the location of its corners. This "collapses" the block as shown in the picture to the right. By right-clicking near a corner, you can move the corresponding corner in the direction you are looking. Each face has thus 4 sections. Right-Clicking in one of those sections moves the
corresponding corner. Finally you can create your own vertical slopes!

To extend a corner, you can sneak-right-click with the chisel (not necessarily onto a block) to toggle between the "Shrink" and "Expand" modes. This works for frame and illusion cube blocks. You can create a bunch of new block with this and don't have to wait until the lazy Dev implements more blocks! This feature is still WIP, so visual problems can occur. pages.text: UV-coordinates should be fixed at the corners of the block or at the actual corners.

pages.title: Fixed UV values!
pages.text: With fixed values, the texture remains intact but might look distorted.

pages.title: Relaxed UV values!
pages.text: Otherwise, the texture is adjusted such that it seems like a cut-out block.
